bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Josiah Quincy, January 1, 1894
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 1, 1894.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Accounts for the quarter ended December 31st 1893.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 1, 1894.
Hon., Josiah Quincy, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit herewith the account for contingent expenses of this Consulate General, and my account for compensation, for the quarter ended December 31, 1893, as per subjoined list of inclosures.
I have the honor to be, sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne U. S. Vice Consul
1. Rent and Miscellaneous expense account. 2. Abstract of Contingent expense and five (5) Vouchers 3. General account with certificate of nonabsence.
